summary: Core category support was added across backend and vendor UI (ProductCategory enum, Product.category field, vendor required dropdown, and a canonical frontend category list). However, the backend does not explicitly reject invalid categories as required (it relies on the enum type), and an unrequested migration mechanism/file was introduced, which also conflicts with the constraint that all backend logic remain in backend/main.mo.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend rejects/throws an error when add product is called with a category not in the predefined allowed list.
missing_requirements.reason: The updated addProduct method accepts a ProductCategory variant and stores it, but there is no explicit allowlist validation/trap shown for categories. The requirement explicitly calls for rejecting categories not in the predefined list.

hallucinated_features.description: Added a backend migration module and wiring to run it.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest did not request any migration feature. Additionally, it conflicts with the stated constraint that all backend logic must remain in a single-actor Motoko architecture with all logic in backend/main.mo.
